name: Blue Heron Beach Resort

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath Deluxe unit on the 7th floor. 4 adults and 2 kids. These are on the end of the building and have bay windows next to the dining table and a window in the 2nd bedroom. The units are long and narrow. You can see Disney from the master bedroom, but, watching the fire works from the hotel is over- rated. There are 2 bunk beds in the hall, which are great for the kids. The 2nd bedroom had 2 twins. They were extremely hard and one of the adults slept on the couch because they were so bad. Both bathrooms were very nice and spacious.
reviews.title: Great family accomodations

reviews.text: The view over Lake Bryan is beautiful and serene. Very nice swimming pools and hot tubs. Everything was very clean. The kitchen was very basic. They had salt and pepper shakers, but nothing in them. There was no dish rag or any extra trash bags. But, it served our purpose.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: The resort is in a great location and there are many different restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: Great Family experience

reviews.text: This is an extremely good value for the money.
reviews.title: 2bedroom/2bath deluxe suite amazing..shuttle service is scary!

reviews.text: This was our first family trip taken in many years. We wanted to do Disney on a budget and have a great time. I can not say enough about the Blue Heron and the people who work there. We were able to cook our meals, pack our lunches etc. This alone saved us a lot of money. Our condo type place was clean with a lot of space for all 5 of us. There were 2 really nice balconies to sit on too. I think people need to know it's not a hotel environment. The idea is you take care of yourself while you are there. The BH people provide services but they are not a hotel. If you go to the front desk they will give you whatever supplies you need. If you are looking for personal services go to a hotel and pay for it. Thank you to all the people who work at the Blue Heron.
reviews.title: Wow - Nice place

reviews.text: We stayed here for christmas 2011, to go to Disney, without the Disney price tag...Oh boy, this place was perfect. The kiddie pool was great for our 3 year old. He loved the bunkbeds. He felt special in them, like it was his secret spot. the bathrooms were nice and updated. The bed was GREAT! I see people complaining about the lack of pillows and blankets and towels, we had no such problem. If you ask the front, you can probably get more. If thats all you have to complain about, thats not worth mentioning....cause the price and location negate that. We will stay here again!! you have questions? contact me....cocoabeachshark@yahoo.com
reviews.title: Loved it here, great for family's

reviews.text: The stay at the resort was nice. Comfortable beds and pillows spacious.
reviews.title: Nice Set up- Cobwebs/ Wrong information Given

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Had a few issues such as the message button on the phone would not spot flashing. Had to cover it every night (we were way too busy to call the front desk to bother having it fixed)
reviews.title: Super Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Cobwebs were found on the light fixtures in the hallway.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay, Some Things to Work On

reviews.text: - Top of bunk bed (ceiling) was dirty
reviews.title: Just back from another enjoyable stay at the Blue Heron Beach Resort.

reviews.text: We ended up staying here after I decided our current hotel was not safe. The Blue Heron consists of 2 towers, right on Lake Bryan. All of the rooms have a view of the lake from the room's patio which is very peaceful. We stayed on a 1 bedroom, which had a very comfortable kings size bed for us and a nice bunkbed in the hall area of our son. It was nice to have 2 bathrooms. The kitchen has lots of room and counter space, a bar and table to eat at. The living area was roomy with plenty of space to stretch out and relax.
reviews.title: Clean, safe and comfortable

reviews.text: Parking was ample, and for safety, you could not use the elevator without your room key - nice feature. The pool and hot tub were clean, the pool is heated, not enough for me, but my son enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.text: There is a starbucks, dunkin dounuts, Cici's Pizza, Dollar store, and mini golf place that share a parking lot with the hotel, and a walgreens across the street. There are several other big grocery stores within a couple of miles. Downtown disney is just up the road, as are the parks.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The only thing you must be aware of is that this is a condo and housekeeping is extra.
reviews.title: Great place, no problems!

reviews.text: We loved this condo and will be back.
reviews.title: Great Location Great condo

reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay. The room is really nice and of course clean. The family suite was more than enough room for the 4 of us.
reviews.title: Girls Trip

reviews.text: Just got back from resort.As my last review the beds are more softer after they added a foam mattress.
reviews.title: Starting to need help!

reviews.text: The floors on the other hand are filthy! I have stayed here many times and the tile floors are sooo dirty i always wear scocks because they turn black on the bottom! The fans were also filthy with cobwebs on them. Like i stated before this was my 6th time staying here and the rooms are in need of a major update! The resort is still very quiet.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We stayed on the 14th Floor with the lake view. Cleanliness was perfect. The staff was very helpful. Although we stayed in 1 bedroom condo with 2 adults and kids, it was pretty spacious. Definitely my next visit to Orlando, I am staying there again. Close to Disney and Universal Studios. Premium Outlet mall and Lake Beuna Vista Mall is close. Enough parking space. What else do we need on a vacation.
reviews.title: Awesome is all I've got!!!

reviews.text: We stayed on the 17th floor and the view was spectacular. Loved the resort, the staff was wonderful and were there for me the entire time. The parking was tight, but if you were diligent; you could find a spot. Will stay here every time I am in Orlando from now on!!! Excellent
reviews.title: Dont waste you money or time

description: The Blue Heron Beach Resort, a lakefront resort featuring one- and two-bedroom, condominium-style suites is just one mile from the entrance to the Walt Disney World and located just off Interstate 4 at exit 68. In addition to our immediate proximity to Disney World, we are also just four miles from SeaWorld and their new water park, Aquatica. Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure are eight short miles north on Interstate 4. The Premium Outlet Mall, just one mile from our front door offers discounted merchandise from some of the world’s most recognizable names. We are in the midst of Lake Buena Vista, the primary tourist area where you’ll find hundreds of restaurants, shops and entertainment venues.The Blue Heron Beach Resort offers one- and two-bedroom suites with living room and patio overlooking the resort pools and Lake Bryan. Each suite also has a full kitchen, dining area and two full baths. In-suite amenities include flat screen TVs with DVD players, high speed internet, washer and dryer and Jacuzzi-jetted tub in the master bath. Resort amenities include two heated pools, a kid’s pool, an outdoor hot tub, fitness center, game room, access to the miniature golf course adjacent to the hotel, and water sports available from our own docks on Lake Bryan. Services include a complimentary shuttle to the major theme parks. Parking is free. Our full service concierge can help you with car rental, attraction tickets and/or restaurant reservations.
